Fintona Presbyterian Girls' Grammar

School

The annual speech night of Fintona

P.G.G.S. was held in the Hawthorn Town

Hall on Thursday, December 12. The Rev.

P. J. Murdoch presided, and distributed

the prizes. Other members of tho council

were also present.

The principal reported that the num-

ber of pupils had now reached 404, this

being the full number for which accommo-

dation has been provided. A new prepara-

tory open-air school has been built; and

a senior house, with ample sleeping-out

accommodation, has been opened. Since

the beginning of the war Fintona has

subscribed over £1290 to patriotic funds.

Three music exhibitions have been gained

as well as a Trinity College exhibition; and

the results for the leaving and intermediate

were most satisfactory. In connection with

the Girls' Private Schools Sports Associa-

tion, the school has gained the basketball

championship for 1918, and has been beaten

in tennis by only one other school.

Dr. J. P. Wilson, Mr. Maxwell, M.H.R.,

and Miss Williams, M.A., gave short ad-

dresses.

St. Catherine's College, Castlemaine.

The annual ".peech night and distribu-'

tion of prizes of St. Catherine's College,'

Castlemaine, "was held on Friday evening,

the 13th inst. Dr. Langley (Bishop

of Bendigo) presided. The report, which

was read by the principal (Miss Ruth

T-ingley, niece of the bishop), showed _

year of continued propre-- and success.

The results at the last intermediate ex-

aminations were verv satisfactory, and

the successes ut the different hockey and

tennis matches remarkably good. The

physical culture class, under Miss Ta}'lor

(Helkie Petersen); the elocution, under

jrfiss'llaase: the'music pupds '(Mi«_ Daw-'

son), and the drawing (Miss^Tjcviriy), bad

done good work during the year.

Addresses were given by Canon Vanston

and the Rev. F. A. Hagcnaucrs, and both

speakers referred in glowing terms to the

efficient work done by the school, and to

the high aim of tlie principal, whose great

object was to lit her pupils for whatever

sphere of service they might be called

upon to enter.
